reviews.review:
Dead by Daylight.

Замечательная игра с хорошей графикой и нагнетающими атмосферу ужаса картами.
В этой игре вы можете примерить на себя роль выжившего и маньяка.

Коротко о выживших:

Есть 4 выживших. Имена их перечислять не буду, это не важно. У каждого из них есть свои уникальные перки и способности. Помимо уникальных есть и общие. Игра на английском, поэтому перед тем, как поставить себе какой-либо перк лучше зайти в руководства и узнать о них больше. От правильного выбора умения зависит ваш шанс на выживание.
Во время самой игры вы сможете найти ящики. В этих ящиках могут оказаться различные предметы, действия которых вы сможете усилить с помощью раннее упомянутых перков. Задача выживших - спастись от маньяка. Вам придется завести 5 двигателей, которые откроют доступ к рубильникам, открывающим дверь. Если остается всего один выживший, то на карте появляется люк. У вас появится выбор: либо искать люк (появляется в случайном месте на карте), либо заводить двигатель (и получить больше очков для прокачки). 

Маньяк:

Маньяков существует 3 вида. У них также разные перки и способности.
1. Умеет ставить капканы.
2. Становится невидимым(но когда он уходит в инвиз или выходит из него, звучат колокола. Также если он в инвизе, то у выживших не звучит музыка, означающая присутствие маньяка рядом с ним.)
3. Мужик с бензопилой. Заводя бензопилу нереально разгоняется.
Задача маньяков - повесить выживших на крюки(Во славу сатане, конечно)

После каждой игры вам выдаются очки, которые можно потратить на прокачку ваших персонажей.
В игре присутствует кооператив. Вы можете собраться и поиграть с друзьями между собой, но у вас не получится играть с другими игроками. По моему мнению, это единственный минус игры.

Игра хороша, минусов практически нет. Кому-то она может напомнить Evolve, но наоборот.
Игре не хватает русского языка, т.к. разобраться со всеми перками без должных знаний не получится. Благо есть умельцы, которые все расписали в руководствах.
Игра просто супер поиграл вроде минут десять а оказалось целый час советую всем любителям хороров и мултиплеера!!!!

This game is amazingly fun. Ignore the people mad they can't play with friends. From what I understand you will be able to play with your friends but in my oppinion it makes it much too easy for the survivors if every single person is working together on voice comms.

Simply put if you like co op games chances are you'll love this.

This game is also not for the faint of heart if you don't like your characters in videos games to be put on meat hooks this game might not be for you...
Great game to release stress by swearing alot hahahaha

Игра быстро опленила любителей хоррора. Этот хоррор опленил и меня. "Загнанные в угол, обреченные на гибель, но все же не потерявшие надежду на спасение - метушатся в попытках найти выход из зловещего логова маньяка." - это завораживает. Похожая задумка проскакивала в головах других разработчиков, но в конечном счете не смогла достичь своей реализации. А эта студия нашла таки попытку её реализовать, и между прочим увенчаться успехом. 

Прелести нового геймплея произвели положительное впечатление. В силу своей исключительности, игра добилась хорошего расположения к своим фанатам, а перспективность разработки не имела веских причин чтобы отменяться. Иными словами, пережив релиз, проект не обошли стороной, и его творцы устремлены на реализацию дальнейших нововведений, что только заставит радоваться игроков. В игре присутствуют недоработки, но будем считать, что разработчики их приймут во внимание и их исправность не заставит себя долго ждать. 

Как и в случае с Team Fortress 2, игра вам может наскучить, если вы будете играть один, из чего следует вывод, что играть в неё лучше конечно с друзьями!
10 out of 10 pooping pants.
还可以
Ну игра доволно прикольная, но если вы играете за выживших то это очень хардкорно и практически не возможно выйграть, а если за маньяка, то изи катка)
great game
拔线 开挂 卡BUG 弹射起步自摸  20段50级人皇 有良知的人都知道该给什么评价
This game is the best!

The best part of this game is the concept. Many have tried, but few have mastered a true horror PVP game.  I commend DBD for trying to fill this niche genre, but I;m skeptickal as to what it might become. THIS GAME IS EARLY ACCESS, or at least it feels like an eraly access game.  There are weird bugs, graphics glitches, and a quirky Mount and Blade vibe. The game feels like a first draft, BUT a fantastic first draft.  In conclusion, this game is an amazing start, but only time will tell if the developers stay commited to updating and building this game to new standard in the horror PVP genre
Really Fun Game Highly Recommend it to anyone wanting to buy it

Nach Evolve ein weiteres Spiel mit asymmetrischen (4vs1) Gruppen. Vier Jugendliche versuchen aus einem geschlossen Garten zu entkommen. Dazu müssen die vier Generatoren die sich verteilt im Garten befinden wieder ans laufen bekommen.  Auf dem Gelände ist aber auch ein übermächtiger Massenmörder der versucht die Jugendlichen auf zu halten und zu ermorden.
Somit handelt es sich um ein Schleichspiel bei dem die Gruppe nur gewinnen kann, wenn sie zusammen arbeitet. Im Grunde wurde das Spiel "verstecken" das ihr früher als Kind auf der Straße oder im Wald gespielt habt hier auf den PC übertragen und mit einem Horrorsetting  versehen. SprachChat ist nicht implementiert so dass man sich anderes absprechen muss. 
In der alpha und beta waren keine Bots oder NPCs vorhanden so dass es vorkommen könnte, dass man in der Lobby öfters einige Zeit verbracht hat bis ein Spiel zu Stande kam. Das Spiel selbst hat mir persönlich dann aber Spaß gemacht.

Во время игры (как за убийц, так и выживших) вы постоянно будете сталкиваться с процедурными факторами. С каждым прохождением обстановка будет генерироваться случайно – точки спавна предметов для выживших, расположение строений и прочих вещей, необходимых для выживания, будут постоянно меняться. Кроме того, выжившие никогда не будут знать с каким порождением ада им придется столкнуться на этот раз.

Игра за обе фракции различается геймплейно – выжившие играют с видом от третьего лица, а убийца – от первого. Выбрав игрового персонажа, можно полностью настроить его характерные особенности и одеть по вкусу. По мере игры вы будете получать опыт, который позволит улучшать свое оборудование и открывать перки. Также можно получать бонусы и распространять их на весь отряд.

Оставшиеся в живых вольны выбирать стиль игры – выживать эгоистичным одиночкой или объединиться с друзьями в группу. В последнем случае гораздо больше шансов выжить, хотя бы из-за возможности спасти попавшего в руки убийцы партнера. 

Средств выживания будет не очень много – фонарики, которыми можно слепить монстра, да шкаф, в котором можно спрятаться. Но если вы найдете время для исследования окрестностей, то обнаружите много полезного оборудования и комплектующих для модернизации. Цель выживших – активировать на карте несколько генераторов, что откроет путь к спасению.

Любители жестокости вволю отведут душу, играя за убийц, у которых есть огромные тесаки, бензопилы, капканы и даже паранормальные способности. В будущем пантеон убийц будет серьезно расширен – фанаты фильмов ужасов наверняка обнаружат в игре своих героев. В зависимости от персонажа изменится и геймплей – некоторые могут оставаться невидимыми, другие будут обладать возможностью видеть ауры людей, третьи быстрее всех передвигаться и т.д. 

Dead by Daylight – очень атмосферная игра, особое внимание в которой необходимо уделять звукам – они могут помочь обнаружить убийцу или указать путь к спасительным генераторам. Кроме того, уникальные способности каждого героя, возможность глубокой настройки персонажей, модернизации оборудования и генерируемые уровни делают игру потенциальным хитом лета.

Dead by Daylight. What is there to say about this game? Aside from quite a few bugs I haven't experienced yet, this game is flawless. Keep in mind I am pretty bias about multiplayer horror games. Without further a do, let's actually get into why I'm praising this game so much.

The gameplay format doesn't get tired out as much as some other current titles. So far, I've been playing this game and this game only for the past couple days. Even if there's only private matches and you get nothing out of it, it's still fun as fuck to scare your friends. Hell, it's fun for your friends to scare you! I am not the kind of kid that can handle horror, but this game balances that perfectly. It kind of reminds me of Capture the Flag mixed with Slender (back when it was considered scary.) I'm seriously addicted to this game.

TL:DR Great game 9/10

Resolution issues: 

game launches in 720p resolution, and in the options there is a slider from 0% to 100% , no option to manually input your desired resolution. I Have seen a few work arounds for 1080p but if you are playing in 4k you are fucked. I have even changed the resolution in the ".ini" to 4k, and saved , but when launching the game it is still at shit resolution. 

This really sucks because this seems like a really interesting and original game

Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated

Dead by Daylight is a game were 4 survivors have to fix 5 generators in order to escape. But there is a killer in the same map that tries to hunt you down and kill you. Thats the game explained in 2 sentences, but there is so much more.

I have bought this game a few days after release and now this game is at this point 2,5 years ago released and still running well! At this moment i almost hit the 1400 hours, for a €20 euro game. in 2,5 years, i have experienced almost every update, the goods and the bads.

Actually this game has come from a LONG way to be good as it is now. The first few months was a tremendous hard time to play and love the game. Many bugs, SWF wasnt even here, game crashes, FPS issues, exploits and so on. That was 2016 (the first half year of the release) in a nutshell. Many people joined the game and many left the game. At some point, the reviews were under the 55% positive rate around end 2016 and the game had also ~12k players at a day for a while (now its 30k).

If i look at the game now, its much, much better than it was ever before. The devs did a tremendous good job on make a really good comeback to fix this game, add new content and listen to the community (they really do, trust me). The game came with 12 maps on release, 4 survivors and 3 kill. Now its over 25 maps, 15 survivors and 14 killers! Thats some HUGE variety if you ask me.

Would i recommend the game back in 2016? I dont know. Sometimes yes, sometimes no.

Would i recommend the game now in 2019? Absolutetly! Game is fun to play and more players are playing ever since before (almost then, except on some DLC releases / free weekends)

If you ever consider to play the game by yourself, feel free to add me and im glad to help you with your questions.
Good stuff, needs to get rid of the cheaters tho.

I am absoluelty done waiting for a match to start after being told it has failed 20 times in a row, only to have the round end early or be exploited by people who actually care about their rank. Not to mention all the bugs and lack of party system, makes the real terror just trying to get into a decent game instead of the game itself. I sunk many hours into the beta and was a little hesitant about where the release would go, but a killer against a good set of survivors will at best come away with 1 out of 4 killed. Usually I am that one since I'm trying to save others, and they run away because of fear for losing their rank points. Broken system, broken game.

With everyone being a real person and actions by both hunter and hunted causing a totally different outcome there is never a repetitive or dull moment in this game! Horrifying, yes. Worth buying? Absolutely! I love being chased down in a forest and then sacrificed on a meat hook!
10/10

terrible changes, bugs, broken/overpowered perks on both sides of the field, seemingly lack of care of the development of the game, and toxic playerbase adds up to what could be a great experience if only a few people could pull their heads out of their ass and my uninstalling of the game.

Played since the Beta and honestly it has been pretty fun. The atmosphere when you're the killer is amazing and also the nice feature of your heart beating when the killer is near is an awesome niche to the game.

Now quite a bit of people are complaining that there's no party system or chat system but if you think about it, the DEVs would've thought of implementing a party system just like every other game but they didn't put it in it for one factor, being fairness. 

The first reasoning for the no party system is because it would be extremely one sided for the Survivors to win. 

To reinforce my first reasoning of the party system is because of communication. Because the survivors aren't able to use their mics or type in-game, they aren’t able to know where their teammates are to go distract the killer, heal their teammates or work on the generators. In saying that, this would give the killer fair fighting chance to win. For example, when playing by myself in the beta I would usually lose half of the matches I've played. However when I was playing with my mates while communicating via skype to which we pretty much won every match.

Yes it would be better to have a party system because it’s quite annoying putting up with people leaving and re-joining to join their friends but hey, when life gives you lemons, make lemonade and don't be a little bitch about it.

muito bom

I see so  many reviews giving this a thumbs down just because there is no "RANKED" co op. So there is Co-op just not with strangers, I can't blame them as I would really enjoy that as well but clearly their just too sore over the fact they can't play with their friends and gain experience together. Honestly the game would be broken if it was implemented as if anyone understood what the game was meant to be, I think they should be more understanding towards that fact.

1. The Killer would always be handicapped in these situations, for example; a killer with Insidious perk has to stand completely still for a few seconds in order to receieve stealth and no terror radius. If I was killer I would stand nearby and camp obviously. If I was going against 4 friends, the one caught just has to inform them I'm invisible and then they all could punish me for the camp. Why would they ever well knowingly walk into a trap. knowing I am completely invisible and waiting. All they have to do is seperate and grab an easy 3 generator. Which is absolutely insane.

2. Talking only creates more annoying situations, if one survior is just being an absolute ass. He'll just taunt me (the killer) with his annoying ass voice so I'd probably stop following him or go insane listening to that rubbish. Even if I could gain from hearing their talk online, what about the ones that use thrid party software. Killer again has absolutely no chance once again. It completely destroys the games intentions and horrorfic moments that makes this game so wonderful to play when it happens.

3. It simply takes away some of the horror elements this game presents, it's complete silence and horror. Your wit alone could win the game. Can you outsmart another human player thats chasing the crap out of you in pure evil intent to hook and slice you into many little pieces, i'm sure many nay sayers couldn't so they bring up these topics and expects indie developers to fix every little problem that comes their way. Which is hilarious since other game companys that are 100x bigger and 100000x more wealthy won't even bother.

These are just a few examples why it probably won't ever be implemented (unless with much handicap to the friends). It just simply doesn't work in this games formula. Silence, Horror, Patience, Dexterity, and Wit. Gamers nowadays lack much patience and wit. So thats probably why they fail to get this game. They simply were betas amongst many alphas.

Only two things this game needs is 1. lobby to invite friends. not private match 2. punish people that dc to keep rank because in the end, the killer is the one getting slashed.  Killers gotta put work in to find these people just to have them dc when they hit the hook.  Not fair to us.  But that same guy will be sitting at the exit doing the halo dance is we didn't find them.  Help a murderer out lol.  Great game!!!! Loads of fun. Get it so i can hunt u down. Muhahaha
This game is an overhyped jank piece of glitchware. There's really only one way to play this game and when that's figured out basically every round will run the same way.

[UPDATE]  So a few of the systems HAVE been fixed.  While it is still furiously glitchy at times, and unbalanced as all hell at others, I would at least recommend it now.  There are very few well-done asymetric games, and this one is at the top of the heap currently.

If only a few issues were fixed, this could be the game that Evolve wanted to be.  WIth connectivity issues, bugs that constantly crash the game, and people exploiting the system with no drawbacks... I... well I still have hope.
nice

Initially when I played this game, I loathed it, the survivors were tenatious and I didn't get a kill, let alone down a single person. After the long period of time where I didn't touch it a single time, a friend got me to download it once more. I wouldn't say that I hate this game nearly as much as I did back then, but I wouldn't say that I love it either. There are some definite things that need fixing with the game and sadly I don't think they will BUT there is some redeeming qualities. There are more killers now than there were, most of which are more fun to play as and when playing with friends, I found it to be quite enjoyable. 
Would I recommend the game to someone that just wants to play alone? God no. The ranking system is broken beyond belief, I was being matched up against people that were under 10 when I can't even make it past rank 19 and the almost monthly rank reset is just plain stupid. 
Would I recommend the game to someone that wants to play with a mate or two, definitely. At least the "Kill your friends" is a viable option when you just play without serious connection issues/exploiters/quitters (That is if your friends don't do that.)

I love this game. I also hate it.

The gameplay is a lot of fun, right up until you run into survivors who know the loop spots on the maps. These are spots where they can jump through a window, and then another window, or a wall, and then another wall infinitely. There is no way to stop them and there is no way to catch them unless they make a mistake which is pretty hard to do.

The Devs promised they would fix it back when the game was first released, but they didn't. Came back during the free weekend years later to find that people are still doing the same thing. Pointless. Don't waste your time, it's an exerise in complete frustration.

I keep playing this game because of its consistency and it doesnt ever really let me down. I keep coming back due to familiarity, and its the one of the only games that i can chill and relax to. (granted i have 4k total hours)

不错的游戏，推荐一下，匹配能和好友就好了。

[h1] The Gist of the Killers and Survivors [/h1]

Dead by Daylight is an asymmetrical, multiplayer, survival horror game that pits 4 survivors against 1 killer. Currently, there are 4-survivor characters in the roster to choose from. There isn’t a real difference between these survivors since the Bloodweb (the upgrading system) gives you random perks and item drops per level. 

For the killers, there is the Trapper, who specializes in using contraptions like bear traps to catch their human prey. Another killer is a shaman like assassin called the Wraith. The Wraith takes advantage of the darkness and can almost become completely invisible. In its specter mode, a translucent distortion in the near vicinity can alert the survivors to the Wraith’s presence. This staff-wielding predator cannot attack in its Specter mode but if planned well, the Wraith can surprise an unsuspecting survivor. Lastly, there is the Hillbilly, a chainsaw wielding disfigured man who can charge towards any survivors without any reservations with his blood caked chainsaw. The roar of his thirsty, unforgiving friend is the only warning a survivor needs to get the hell out of dodge.

---

 [h1] Gameplay [/h1]

Four survivors are trapped in an arena with a killer and their main objective is to simply avoid the killer and escape, preferably alive. They’re dropped in 1 of the 3 maps currently available. The maps are chosen at random in the start of every game.

 [b] The Survivors [/b]

 I’d like to start with some of the strategies I picked up during my time as a survivor. First things first, survivors can attain victory when a certain amount of generators are fixed to power up the gates, which are the sought after exits. Exit to what, you may ask? To more swamp, I guess. Maybe there’s a McDonalds on the other side and you can buy the killer a nice little happy meal.

 A simple heartbeat is an important sound cue for them and listening intently for this can mean life or death. Sprinting can make a survivor’s tracks more likely to be seen by the killer so a smart survivor knows never to run unless the popos…I mean unless the killer is giving chase. 

Working with members of the team can turn the tide of the game but if the killer seizes a teammate and hoists them up in their strong shoulders, unless someone has a flashlight (this item can temporarily blind a killer), there’s not much anyone can do (You can do what I do and go up to the killer and give them a hug because really, just share your love. Don’t be stingy, fool.) You can start your very own rescue operation and bring your fellow survivor down from the meat hook but take heed; the killer could still be lingering nearby. If and when you do this, feel free to heal them up and be kind a Samaritan.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=707699468

 [b] The Killer [/b]

As mentioned earlier, there are 3 killers. They use their distinct arsenal of traps and deadly weapons to capture their prey and prop them up on a meat hook to sacrifice them to the Entity, a supernatural being whose hunger is never satiated. The shape of unpowered generators is lit up to make things a little easier on the killer since they are hunting four little mice scurrying about (the location of these generators are randomly generated.) The slightest crunch of branches or the rustle of the grass can mean that a person might be nearby. Also, the orchestra will be following closely behind you because there’s nothing like a good chase music to get you in the mood to murder. 

There is an upgrade system, called the Bloodweb, available to both the survivors and killers. Every level-up, the player can choose a perk and item drops that are organized in a web-like fashion. This is randomized so there’s a chance for a rare or common perk/item drop to appear. 
 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=707699326

---

 [h1] Did ya scare me? [/h1]

The scare factor of this game, on the scale of 1-10, I rate Dead by Daylight a 7 out of 10. 7 being, “Thank you! I hope this spooky feeling lasts!”

I played the beta version and my first round was one of the most heart-pounding experiences I’ve ever felt in a game. The adrenaline that courses through you as you trudge along the murky, and foggy planes of the map is quite something else. For obvious reasons, playing as the survivor brings forth more of the survival horror aspect of the game while the killer puts you in a role of a powerful hunter that emits the DGAF attitude.

I wasn’t expecting much the first time I booted the game so I was in for a surprise during my first match. The atmosphere can be creepy and nerve wracking, especially if you can hear the killer, like the Hillbilly charging his chainsaw, in the distance. Wearing headphones is extremely recommended because the ambient sounds can be unsettling at times. Most of the time in a public lobby, it’s every survivor for themselves but I do make an effort to try and save any survivor in my team. 

Through repeated exposures in the full game, I still find gameplay somewhat exciting and hand trembling inducing (in my case that is). I am not usually keen in playing multiplayer games but I’m not bored with this game…yet.

---

 [h1] Graphics and Technical Issues [/h1]

Although there isn’t much to tweak within the graphics option, the performance of the game is consistent. My frames haven’t dropped below 60 (Specs: GTX 970, i7-4790S, 12 GB of ram…so on and so forth). I’ve crashed a few times and from what I witnessed, a friend of mine crashed 3 times in an hour time span.  The multiplayer might not be as stable because there were some disconnections in some games. A not so great internet connection or Steam can be blamed for this phenomenon.

Dead by Daylight’s haunting environments just adds a nice flavor to each match but I just wished there was more variety to the maps. As time goes on, they start looking the same.

---

 [h1] Wrap Up [/h1]

I can say that I can recommend this game to any horror or non-horror fans. It’s a great game to get lost in for a couple of hours a day. It isn’t the type of game that I can play for hours and hours but leveling up is progressive enough to make you come back for more. Each match can be surprising, depending on your team and how the killer goes about their hunting routines. 

For now, I am enjoying this game but I do wish that we can invite friends in a public lobby because the game can be fun fooling around with friends. Sometimes, I don’t want to go in there alone (I do understand that the killer will be at a disadvantage if, for example, there is a group of 4 people in some kind of VOIP program.) With that said, this will rid of the loneliness and suspense you would feel if you soldier through a game by yourself so there’s a pro and con if this feature is implemented in the game.

The host can create a private lobby but I have only one other friend who has this game and you can’t earn experience points in these matches. So if you got this far and you’re thinking of buying Dead by Daylight, feel free to add me. 

Thanks for reading!

---

 [h1] TL;DR  [/h1]

 [b] Pros: [/b]

 -Heart pounding killer versus survivors matches
- Haunting environments and sounds
- Progressive leveling up system
- Killers are fun to play
- It’s suspenseful playing as the survivors
- Consistent framerate
- Every survivor for themselves

[b] Cons: [/b]

- Crashes
- Disconnections from multiplayer
- Cannot invite friends from public lobbies

---

If you stuck around me this long, and if you have the time, watch me fool around in Dead by Daylight.

像我这种技术菜的，玩这个太惊悚了，受不了

游戏还是很不错的，毒性跟守望屁股有的一拼
优点：1，氛围营造，够刺激，不管是环境，还是心跳的机制，都恰到好处
          2，讲究配合，救人，溜人，利用心理战抓人，都是这个游戏的爽点所在，一旦成功，成就感爆棚，并且大神会做出比常人更加出色的选择，让人惊叹，因此非常适合直播
           3，可解锁的附加技能和献祭技能非常丰富，技能搭配很有意思

缺点：1.没中文，3DM出个内核汉化，突然一天内就疯传汉化会被封号，搞得人心惶惶
           2.对付外挂的水准，并非一线公司能达到的，会不会鬼服就看开发商下一步行动了
           3.不健全的评分机制，导致现在刷分党，拔线党盛行，既然出了天梯，就要做好评分机制，避免因为机制不健全导致的不健康的游戏方式，这个还是得看开发商功力了。


总之还是希望这游戏继续火下去，把上面三个缺点解决了，估计要成事儿

Most of my complaints have been fixed since I last reviewed this, and I find it pretty fun now. Just wish more people played still. Players tend to also be very toxic believe it or not. Also gets repetitive pretty quick.

[Strike]First off, I would like to clarify that this game is a great concept, and is very fun with friends. However, this game needs to be an early access game, since it certainly has the bugs of one.

1. Needs desparate fixing. Sometimes wasd will just break, and you can't move. Or trying to swap from one role to the other breaks your game.

2. There needs to be a bigger reason for the killer to not camp someone on a hook. There honestly is no current reason for the killer to leave them because they know the survivors are just waiting for you to leave. You can power the generators while he camps, but most of the killers honestly don't give a shit. So you can either leave and give the person back or camp and confirm the kill.

3. Can get pretty repetitive after a while, needs more gamemodes and more content.

4. There needs to be some sort of stamina system for survivors vaulting over things. It's currently vaulting simulator since the survivor can so easily evade the killer by just constantly vaulting over the same thing over and over again.

5. Needs more than one way to kill survivors other than just hooking them. The hook is already boring, I would love to see them be thrown into a pit of needles (Saw style) or something, and survivors need to pull them out, just needs more variety.

6. [Strike]Can only play with friends in a private match. This sort of makes sense, but if you both are playing as survivors there is no reason not to implement that.[/Strike]

7. Ranking up and item system is confusing. Seems lazily made.

8. Game badly needs optimizing. Frames tend to get choppy (no pun intended).

9. [Strike]Keys aren't rebindable.[/Strike]

10. Matchmaking system is pretty broken.

I really want to give this a positive review. However, there's just too many bugs and not enough content for me to give it. This game is very exhilerating and fun with friends, and has the potential to be much better than it currently is.[/Strike]

Bon jeu, gameplay très répétitif cependant, il faut aimer, j'ai du mal à comprendre pourquoi des ajouts plus majeurs n'ont pas été fait à la boucle de gameplay depuis des années, parce que certes, le jeu à son public mais j'ai l'impression que les joueurs ne reviennent que périodiquement lors des événements, le fait que les maps soient générées de manière procédurale est agréable mais la façon dont est construit les niveaux laisse à désirer, c'est absurde pour un survivant de tourner 30 fois autour d'une caisse pour éviter le tueur que pour le tueur de faire de même, on se demande parfois qui est le chassé..
Le système de générateurs est archaïque et devrait profiter d'un rework (ajouter des micro puzzles à la Among Us / faire une interface de câblage comme les tuyaux dans Bioshock..) 

Bref, globalement le jeu est plein de bonnes idées mais également plein de mauvaises et la communauté est exécrable les 3/4 du temps. 

Si je pouvais mettre un pouce neutre je le ferais, je laisse un avis positif car j'ai quand même beaucoup joué au jeu donc c'est que quelque part la magie opère mais le potentiel n'est clairement pas exploité à fond et l'immersion est difficile la plupart du temps, ce qui est dommage pour un jeu survival horreur.

Let me start this off by saying I've played this game since the day it released in beta (June 1st, 2016). The game has evolved so much, some good, some bad which is understandable. However the community is the worst I've ever been a part of. The community went from being close knit, helpful and fun, to jaded, angry, and spiteful. This is the ONLY community I've been a part of where people will leave negative comments on your profile if they didn't like how you played.

I'm going to keep this short and sweet:

PROS:

- Constant updates. New content is being released every other month. Some of it being free.
- Paid DLCs are more than fair in price. Offering a new killer, map and survivor for $5-$7.
- Cheap game, tons of hours to put in it.
- Devs regularly do dev streams on Twitch.
- Prestiging a survivor/killer gives you extra incentive to continue leveling.
- No microtransactions.

CONS:

- Questionable balance changes to perks/ gameplay. Devs are too nerf happy. If something LOOKS OP, they nerf it into the ground. They also balance the game around rank 20's (the lowest rank in the game) and rarely make changes based around rank 1 (highest rank) feedback.
- The community rivals the League of Legends community in terms of toxicity. Constant whining and crying from the community make the game unbearable at times.

REGARDLESS of the cons, I will admit this game is well worth the price. Just be prepared to deal with a toxic community.
I stopped playing because the balancing always favored the monster (and my game kept crashing, even after multiple "fixes")
